annotations.openshift.io/display-name: Job to deploy a container image registry.

source.dockerfile:
FROM openshift/cli:latest
RUN dnf update -y --skip-broken --nobest ||:
# TODO: jq is not yet available in EPEL-8
RUN dnf install -y \
  https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-7.noarch.rpm && \
  dnf install -y jq
RUN dnf install -y \
  https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-8.noarch.rpm && \
  dnf install -y parallel procps-ng bc git httpd-tools && dnf clean all -y
# TODO: determine OCP version from environment
COPY https://mirror.openshift.com/pub/openshift-v4/clients/ocp/latest-${OCP_MINOR_RELEASE}/openshift-client-linux.tar.gz /tmp/
COPY https://mirror.openshift.com/pub/openshift-v4/clients/ocp/latest-${OCP_MINOR_RELEASE}/sha256sum.txt /tmp/
# verify the downloaded tar
RUN /bin/bash -c 'f=/tmp/openshift-client-linux.tar.gz; \
  got="$(awk '"'"'{print $1}'"'"' <(sha256sum "$f"))"; \
  exp="$(awk '"'"'/openshift-client-linux-/ {print $1}'"'"' /tmp/sha256sum.txt | head -n 1)"; \
  if [[ "$got" != "$exp" ]]; then printf \
    '"'"'Unexpected hashsum of %s (expected "%s", got "%s")\n!'"'"' "$f" "$exp" "$got" >&2; \
    exit 1; \
  fi'
RUN /bin/bash -c 'tar -C /usr/local/bin/ -xzvf /tmp/openshift-client-linux.tar.gz -T <(printf oc)'
RUN rm -rfv /tmp/*
# TODO: verify signatures as well
RUN mkdir -p /usr/local/bin /usr/local/share/openshift-acme
RUN git clone --depth 5 --single-branch \
  --branch ${LETSENCRYPT_REVISION} \
  ${LETSENCRYPT_REPOSITORY} /usr/local/share/openshift-acme
RUN git clone --depth 5 --single-branch \
  --branch ${SDI_OBSERVER_GIT_REVISION} \
  ${SDI_OBSERVER_REPOSITORY} /usr/local/share/sap-data-intelligence
RUN for bin in observer.sh deploy-registry.sh deploy-letsencrypt.sh; do \
      cp -lv $(find /usr/local/share/sap-data-intelligence \
                -type f -executable -name "$bin") \
        /usr/local/bin/$bin; \
      chmod a+rx /usr/local/bin/$bin; \
    done
RUN ln -s /usr/local/share/sap-data-intelligence /usr/local/share/sdi
WORKDIR /usr/local/share/sdi
CMD ["/usr/local/bin/observer.sh"]

parameters.description:
If set to true, no action will be performed. The pod will just print
what would have been executed.
parameters.name: DRY_RUN

parameters.description:
The desired namespace to deploy resources to. Defaults to the current
one.
parameters.name: NAMESPACE

parameters.description:
Whether to forcefully replace existing objects and configuration files. To replace
exising secrets as well, RECREATE_SECRETS needs to be set.
parameters.name: FORCE_REDEPLOY

parameters.description: Whether to replace secrets like SDI Registry's htpasswd file if they exist already.
parameters.name: REPLACE_SECRETS

parameters.description:
Whether to replace existing persistent volume claims like the one belonging to SDI
Registry.
parameters.name: REPLACE_PERSISTENT_VOLUME_CLAIMS

parameters.description: Unless given, the default storage class will be used.
parameters.name: SDI_REGISTRY_STORAGE_CLASS_NAME

parameters.description:
Will be used to generate htpasswd file to provide authentication data to the sdi registry
service as long as SDI_REGISTRY_HTPASSWD_SECRET_NAME does not exist or REPLACE_SECRETS is
"true".
parameters.name: SDI_REGISTRY_USERNAME

parameters.description:
Will be used to generate htpasswd file to provide authentication data to the sdi registry
service as long as SDI_REGISTRY_HTPASSWD_SECRET_NAME does not exist or REPLACE_SECRETS is
"true".
parameters.name: SDI_REGISTRY_PASSWORD

parameters.description:
A secret with htpasswd file with authentication data for the sdi image container If
given and the secret exists, it will be used instead of SDI_REGISTRY_USERNAME and
SDI_REGISTRY_PASSWORD.
parameters.name: SDI_REGISTRY_HTPASSWD_SECRET_NAME

parameters.description:
Desired hostname of the exposed registry service. Defaults to
container-image-registry-<NAMESPACE>-apps.<cluster_name>.<base_domain>
parameters.name: SDI_REGISTRY_ROUTE_HOSTNAME

parameters.description:
A random piece of data used to sign state that may be stored with the client to protect
against tampering. If omitted, the registry will automatically generate a secret when it
starts. If using multiple replicas of registry, the secret MUST be the same for all of
them.
parameters.name: SDI_REGISTRY_HTTP_SECRET

parameters.description: Volume space available for container images (e.g. 120Gi).
parameters.name: SDI_REGISTRY_VOLUME_CAPACITY

parameters.description:
If the given SDI_REGISTRY_STORAGE_CLASS_NAME or the default storate class supports
"ReadWriteMany" ("RWX") access mode, please change this to "ReadWriteMany".
parameters.name: SDI_REGISTRY_VOLUME_ACCESS_MODE

parameters.description:
Whether to expose routes annotated for letsencrypt controller. Requires project admin
role attached to the sdi-observer service account. Letsencrypt controller must be
deployed either via this observer or cluster-wide for this to have an effect.
parameters.name: EXPOSE_WITH_LETSENCRYPT

parameters.description:
Minor release of OpenShift Container Platform (e.g. 4.2). This value must match the OCP
server version. The biggest tolerated difference between the versions is 1 in the second
digit.
parameters.name: OCP_MINOR_RELEASE

parameters.description: URL of SDI Observer's git repository to clone into sdi-observer image.
parameters.name: SDI_OBSERVER_REPOSITORY

parameters.description: Revision (e.g. tag, commit or branch) of SDI Observer's git repository to check out.
parameters.name: SDI_OBSERVER_GIT_REVISION

parameters.description: Pull specification of the built SDI Observer image.
parameters.name: JOB_IMAGE

parameters.description: Arguments for job's script. Passed as a json array of strings.
parameters.name: SCRIPT_ARGUMENTS

parameters.description:
Pull specification for the base image for sdi-observer and/or container-image-registry.
The base image shall be RPM based and contain "dnf" binary for package management.
parameters.name: SOURCE_IMAGE_PULL_SPEC

parameters.description: Name of the imagestream to use for the custom source image.
parameters.name: SOURCE_IMAGESTREAM_NAME

parameters.description: Tag in the custom source imagestream referring to the SOURCE_IMAGE_PULL_SPEC.
parameters.name: SOURCE_IMAGESTREAM_TAG
